subject: Art & Design
title: Emotional Design: Don Norman's Three Levels
description: A short lesson to help you apply Emotional Design: Don Norman's Three Levels.

hook.text: People keep beautiful but broken watches and ugly but functional tools. Don Norman explains why: three levels of design.

buildup.text: Visceral design: instant reaction (looks good). Behavioral: usability (works well).

discovery.text: A Mini Cooper is viscerally cute, behaviorally fun to drive, and reflectively a statement about the owner.

twist.text: You can compensate between levels. An ugly tool can succeed behaviorally.

climax.text: Apple masters all three: sleek (visceral), intuitive (behavioral), status symbol (reflective).

punchline.text: Products aren't just used. They're felt, experienced, and owned.

quiz.question: What are Don Norman's three levels of emotional design?
